topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540e13cf63687261df470000#post_540e13cf63687261df470000
[bq="Princess♠Molestia"]"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540e11a263687241b58a0100#post_540e11a263687241b58a0100
If I remember right, if you actually used 100% of you brain. As in, All of it firing off full cylinders at once. You'd be having a seizure, a bad one.

If I'm wrong, I'm sure uc9 can correct it. He is most smart.[/bq]
You actually use almost all of your brain pretty much all the time; it's just that most of your brain's functions are for bodily functions.  A seizure is more along the lines of when you put a microphone next to a speaker; the neural synapses keep firing and don't stop creating metaphorical noise.
!http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/544/281/71d.png!
